occupation: Founder & Chief Executive Officer at Advantage Club
headline: Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder at Advantage Club. Hiring rockstars in Product, Engineering, UI/UX & Alliances (US, India, SE-Asia & Dubai) | YC S21
summary:
Co-Founded Advantage Club. Advantage Club is a global platform for employee engagement and financial wellness. Previously worked for Microsoft's Bing team and Amazon's Lab 126. I completed my masters in computer science from University of California at LA.

I believe in getting things done. Outside work I love to socialize, interact with like-minded people, fellow entrepreneurs, travel places and jump from wherever I can.

experiences.title: Founder & Chief Executive Officer
experiences.description: Advantage Club is a global platform for employee engagement and financial wellness including perks, rewards and early wage access. We bring multiple employee benefits on the same platform and are live with 370+ companies across 60+ countries. I am responsible for the company's vision, product and strategic developments.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder
experiences.description: We were focused on employee perks for SME to large companies and then eventually pivoted to a better model in 2019.

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.description: In a team of 4 we started a venture while pursuing under graduation at Thapar University. We made a local portal for the city and tried to cater to localized requirements of students in Patiala.

experiences.title: Software Developer Engineer
experiences.description: I worked in the core team of Bing on layer 2 ranking

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: I interned with Natural Language Group of Office. During 12 weeks of my internship worked on 4 projects which were all in different stages of product life cycle.

experiences.title: Software Developer
experiences.description: Built the first version of platform search for kindle devices

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: I worked with STAR team which works on core Malware technologies used by Symantec in Norton.

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: Worked on ADF on migrating Oracle Web Communities from Enterprise 1.0 to Enterprise 2.0

accomplishment_publications.name: Evaluation and Extension to the Duckworth Lewis Method: A Dual Application of Data Mining Techniques
accomplishment_publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 11th IEEE International Conference on Data Mining Workshops (ICDMW 2011)
accomplishment_publications.description:
This paper deals with the evaluation of the Duckworth Lewis method, identifying its limitation, and devising a modification to address these limitations. The Duckworth Lewis method, or D/L method, was created by Frank Duckworth and Tony Lewis. The International Cricket Council (ICC) adopted D/L method in 1999 to address the issue of delayed one-day cricket matches due to interruptions such as inclement weather conditions, poor light and floodlight failures, and crowd problems. We have attempted to identify the shortcomings in the existing Duckworth Lewis method using data mining algorithms such as Random Forests and C4.5.

We have also shown that the p-values and other data mining techniques serve a dual purpose of not only evaluating whether systems such as D/L method have been exploited by taking advantage of their properties such as simplicity, but also devising alternate and robust approaches (or models).

accomplishment_publications.name: SEAS-Expert system for advising academic major
accomplishment_publications.publisher: IEEE Xplore, International Advance Computing Conference’2010
accomplishment_publications.description: Most students in India choose their undergraduate major solely on the basis of persisting trends in the society. Due to the lack of a holistic guidance system, students often end up making choices solely on the basis of the above parameter, which in eventuality, may fail to align with the student’s actual interest and inherent aptitude towards a particular major. In this paper we propose an expert system-SAES which aims to provide intelligent advice to the student as to which major he/she should opt. SAES acquires knowledge of academic performances as well as explicit and implicit interests of the candidate. Knowledge representation in SAES is done by the use of a combination of case based and rule based reasoning. SAES draws inferences on the basis of acquired knowledge and also takes into account the degree of dilemma faced by the candidate and the time he/she takes to decide the interest areas. SAES then recommends the most suitable majors for each candidate, which are further classified as strong, mild and weak on the basis of calculated relative probabilities of success. At the end, we analyze results of the test conducted on a working prototype of SAES.

accomplishment_projects.title: Organizing The Army Exhibition event "ShauryaGaatha" Successfully for 3 years at Thapar University Technical Festival - ARANYA
accomplishment_projects.description: A salute to the great Armed Forces of our Nation INDIA from the students' of Thapar University. This event showcases the latest equipment used by the Indian Army.
